subject: remove default value of repeat-actions
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-10 05:43:17.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'ceilometerclient/v2/shell.py', 'ceilometerclient/tests/unit/v2/test_shell.py'], 'message': "remove default value of repeat-actions

I94468ff649dd4367848c74e94a3feb08494bb223 fixes problem that ceilometeclient
incorrectly reset repeat-actions when update any attribute.

I53f3af447a8f814388985f6e4ab57a8ffec18a2a reverts most of the above change,
which leading to bug 1539092. Because repeat-actions has default value False,
no matter we set it or not, it will replace this bit when we get alarm from API.

The unit test doesn't cover such case, so this change still succeeds in CI test.

We don't need to revert it again, because the redundant code for create and update
is not needed, repeat-actions has default value (False) in API side, so the proper
way is simply removing the default value in CLI side.

Change-Id: I39c28294db3e55141bb8a2024a6ddfdf8acf5e0d
Closes-Bug: #1539092
"}]
commit_message:
remove default value of repeat-actions

I94468ff649dd4367848c74e94a3feb08494bb223 fixes problem that ceilometeclient
incorrectly reset repeat-actions when update any attribute.

I53f3af447a8f814388985f6e4ab57a8ffec18a2a reverts most of the above change,
which leading to bug 1539092. Because repeat-actions has default value False,
no matter we set it or not, it will replace this bit when we get alarm from API.

The unit test doesn't cover such case, so this change still succeeds in CI test.

We don't need to revert it again, because the redundant code for create and update
is not needed, repeat-actions has default value (False) in API side, so the proper
way is simply removing the default value in CLI side.

Change-Id: I39c28294db3e55141bb8a2024a6ddfdf8acf5e0d
Closes-Bug: #1539092

commit_message:
Fixed corner cases of incorrect use of oslo.config

In the tests there are some corner cases where we call oslo.config.cfg
fild_file before CONF, which is the incorrect use of oslo.config. This
patch fixes those.

Change-Id: Idf02156a4d8f8c92aa8f4aaf24ff2c3780b9b3c9
Closes-Bug: #1547612

commit_message:
Fix ignore-db-dir problem after switch from wsrep.cnf to my.cnf

Switch from custom MySQL config to the global one in the Galera case
would reproduce the old MySQL bug [1] when duplicate settings used
when the mysql_install_db executed.

This commit can be safely reverted when we switch puppetlabs-mysql
to the head with PR#808 merged.

[1] https://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=69441

Change-Id: Ie05c9b6dd664e6cf6fb891422de107b6d0f1c2e7
Partial-Bug: #1484552

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-03-08 17:10:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/openstack-service-api/policy.service.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/openstack-service-api/policy.service.spec.js'], 'message': 'Angular Policy Caching

With angular routing, every time a view / page is shown, any
policy checks are performed again. Policy decisions are fairly
static and should not change as long as the inputs are the same.

This patch makes it so that the results are cached until
a django page reload is triggered (such as when region, user,
project, panel are changed).

Change-Id: Ib8c133f680a7bf0357c26263fb26bb76eb13d65a
Closes-Bug: 1551815
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Angular Policy Caching

With angular routing, every time a view / page is shown, any
policy checks are performed again. Policy decisions are fairly
static and should not change as long as the inputs are the same.

This patch makes it so that the results are cached until
a django page reload is triggered (such as when region, user,
project, panel are changed).

Change-Id: Ib8c133f680a7bf0357c26263fb26bb76eb13d65a
Closes-Bug: 1551815
Co-Authored-By: Matt Borland <matt.borland@hpe.com>

commit_message:
Enable import backup in tempest

This patch is to enable backup import test as the bug 1455043
is fixed.

When the backup to import still exists in current system, cinder
can't import the backup. This patch also adds deletion of the backup
after exporting a backup.

Change-Id: I8f00f8f784e32bd519b0245853a97b48cd116b15

commit_message:
rewrite wait condition script

rewriting wait condition script in the following manner:

* trying to send signal until successed, because sometimes
heat can be unavailable;

* insecure flag passed to allow wait condition work when
SSL enabled. Since this signal don't have any important
info, we can use this flag until secured way to pass certificate
will be invented.

Change-Id: I6a8003af8ae655ed49c7f93dacc8420d7d7a5054
Closes-bug: 1532766
Closes-bug: 1535274

commit_message:
Fix invalid UUID warnings for test_volume_*

Currently running 'tox -epy27 -- --regex test_volume' emits over 50
FutureWarnings from oslo_versioned_objects about invalid UUIDs [1].

This commit modifies relevant unit tests so that these warnings are
no longer emitted.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Change-Id: Id165450ff4c1c7c6aac13a8916e2e72cfade199e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 08:50:41.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/auth_url.py'], 'message': 'Make auth_url lookup dynamic

If _get_auth_url() is run on heat-api startup, it can cause heat-api to crash
in situations where Keystone is not running, yet or temporarily unavailable.
This patch converts the auth_url attribute into a property method that is only
run when it is needed, thus preventing this race condition.

Change-Id: Ife6d9e51ea9647e4658105c016867efe769e5363
Closes-Bug: #1550284
(cherry picked from commit fe9226898772c4ff909f9c3f0cb05c271333b73a)
'}]
commit_message:
Make auth_url lookup dynamic

If _get_auth_url() is run on heat-api startup, it can cause heat-api to crash
in situations where Keystone is not running, yet or temporarily unavailable.
This patch converts the auth_url attribute into a property method that is only
run when it is needed, thus preventing this race condition.

Change-Id: Ife6d9e51ea9647e4658105c016867efe769e5363
Closes-Bug: #1550284
(cherry picked from commit fe9226898772c4ff909f9c3f0cb05c271333b73a)

commit_message:
Fail mysql OCF script if mysql dies

Occasionally galera init can fail, but it will work
on the next try. Reducing the time it takes for the OCF
script to fail will enable pacemaker to retry and pass
without failing on a 300s timeout.

Change-Id: I8704bf7c52964bb59bec3cab359909a85f4def73
Closes-Bug: #1552153

PyMI was updated in the case of association classes.
Currently when an association class is retrieved, its
properties which are references will be returned as strings.
The new PyMI update converts automatically the references
and returns the objects.

This patch changes the way in which class properties that
are references are treated, objects are expected now
instead of strings.

Change-Id: Ibb49b99604492ac72dd46482bb1f9daf98171c32
'}]
commit_message:
Changes how association classes are treated

PyMI was updated in the case of association classes.
Currently when an association class is retrieved, its
properties which are references will be returned as strings.
The new PyMI update converts automatically the references
and returns the objects.

This patch changes the way in which class properties that
are references are treated, objects are expected now
instead of strings.

Change-Id: Ibb49b99604492ac72dd46482bb1f9daf98171c32

subject: Upgrades: quiet yum upgrade on cinder nodes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 15:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['extraconfig/tasks/major_upgrade_block_storage.sh'], 'message': 'Upgrades: quiet yum upgrade on cinder nodes

Yum update on cinder nodes should be quiet, as it is on controllers,
because results of these updates are sent to Heat. I mistakenly left
this out in the first patch because i used one of the standalone node
upgrade scripts as a copy/paste base for the cinder node upgrade script.

Change-Id: Id13190dc4d242317829c7994088183f52d21461d
(cherry picked from commit d4b8297b31179f82ea3c31653802fcc1d4070e6d)
'}]
commit_message:
Upgrades: quiet yum upgrade on cinder nodes

Yum update on cinder nodes should be quiet, as it is on controllers,
because results of these updates are sent to Heat. I mistakenly left
this out in the first patch because i used one of the standalone node
upgrade scripts as a copy/paste base for the cinder node upgrade script.

Change-Id: Id13190dc4d242317829c7994088183f52d21461d
(cherry picked from commit d4b8297b31179f82ea3c31653802fcc1d4070e6d)

commit_message:
Fill cinder scheduler filters from cinder modular manifest

Current scheme of filling cinder conf  with updated scheduler filters
in openstack-controller modular manifest is not good, because it is out
of cinder modular task and that's why cinder services could not be
restarted. Let's move this filling to cinder modular manifest.

Change-Id: I7c3bd0c553762b830e3dc48cdc7138664dd5886f
Closes-bug: #1522876

subject: Horizon plug-ins should not have type:library
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-04 14:48:30.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Horizon plug-ins should not have type:library

Horizon plug-ins, while technically delivered as a Python
"library", are not considered a library as far as release
management deadlines are concerned. A few of them still
had the type:library tag, though, so let's fix that.

NB: we may want to introduce a type:horizon-plugin tag at
some point to designate those.

Change-Id: Idedf14a488372d7c2d4120f0637af7b05938b0b8
'}]
commit_message:
Horizon plug-ins should not have type:library

Horizon plug-ins, while technically delivered as a Python
"library", are not considered a library as far as release
management deadlines are concerned. A few of them still
had the type:library tag, though, so let's fix that.

NB: we may want to introduce a type:horizon-plugin tag at
some point to designate those.

Change-Id: Idedf14a488372d7c2d4120f0637af7b05938b0b8

commit_message:
Quota management for Nova-APIGW (part3 os-quota-sets and limits )

Implement os-quota-sets and limits in  Nova-APIGW, support command
quota-show, quota-defaults, quota-update and limits, also can issue
curl to show detail information of quotas.

Quota usage update according to VM provision will be implemented
later

The quota management and control in Tricircle is described in the
design doc:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/18kZZ1snMOCD9IQvUKI5NVDzSASpw-QKj7l2zNqMEd3g/

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tricircle/+spec/implement-stateless

Change-Id: I54ea514630684f78d757cff732b54dafdfa768b6
Signed-off-by: Chaoyi Huang <joehuang@huawei.com>

commit_message:
Use global wait time when waiting for Neutron commands.

When waiting for neutron commands to complete, use a global wait-time
value set in a global location.

In future, we can change the implementation to actively detect and wait
until the command completes. This global could be used as a marker.

Change-Id: Ic637a9c593452da0b735b3e56a0fb0d3cceb04b9

subject: Fix false alert messages in HAProxy logs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-13 08:03:17.000000000', 'files': ['docker/haproxy/extend_start.sh'], 'message': 'Fix false alert messages in HAProxy logs

Bug #1549753 raises false alarm about haproxy to the operator and
monitoring tools even though haproxy is running fine and there is
no issue.

haproxy uses UDP datagram socket for logging and the default queue
length of 10 datagrams causes false alert messages in haproxy
logs. This patch set fixes this bug by increasing the queue length
to 128.

Test results of the fix in this patch set are at
http://paste.openstack.org/show/490302/.

Change-Id: I64fdd17cd278d51616aa0dfa4e8d2a422c8ee630
Closes-Bug: #1549753
'}]
commit_message:
Fix false alert messages in HAProxy logs

Bug #1549753 raises false alarm about haproxy to the operator and
monitoring tools even though haproxy is running fine and there is
no issue.

haproxy uses UDP datagram socket for logging and the default queue
length of 10 datagrams causes false alert messages in haproxy
logs. This patch set fixes this bug by increasing the queue length
to 128.

Test results of the fix in this patch set are at
http://paste.openstack.org/show/490302/.

Change-Id: I64fdd17cd278d51616aa0dfa4e8d2a422c8ee630
Closes-Bug: #1549753

subject: Support query filter for "alarm list" command
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-07 07:31:26.000000000', 'files': ['aodhclient/utils.py', 'aodhclient/v2/alarm.py', 'aodhclient/v2/alarm_cli.py'], 'message': 'Support query filter for "alarm list" command

Currently, we have support query filter in "GET /v2/alarms" API, but we
don't support query filter in aodhclient. Compare to alarm search(complex
query), the query filters with "alarm list" command is more easy to use
and is generally accepted. This change add this functionality.

Change-Id: Ie05f9d3c549b093821775bc0a1d8524f76747b46
'}]
commit_message:
Support query filter for "alarm list" command

Currently, we have support query filter in "GET /v2/alarms" API, but we
don't support query filter in aodhclient. Compare to alarm search(complex
query), the query filters with "alarm list" command is more easy to use
and is generally accepted. This change add this functionality.

Change-Id: Ie05f9d3c549b093821775bc0a1d8524f76747b46

subject: Add centos-minimal build, experimental job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-10 04:41:28.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Add centos-minimal build, experimental job

Add a build of centos-minimal to nodepool.  Let's just add this to
Rackspace first, because that's the "hard" place to get working
(configdrive, no dhcp, etc).  FWIW I have tested this image with my
RAX account.

The plan is to replace devstack-centos7 with this image globally once
we've got it stable.

Add an experimental job to use this new node for testing (devstack
should be able to bootstrap itself on these types of nodes).

Change-Id: I02fd98f5df7f90aa5d50666166b5c736f6f06aaf
Depends-On: I2956aaa49ba3137a799f97e0983ab4b7c93a0a0c
'}]
commit_message:
Add centos-minimal build, experimental job

Add a build of centos-minimal to nodepool.  Let's just add this to
Rackspace first, because that's the "hard" place to get working
(configdrive, no dhcp, etc).  FWIW I have tested this image with my
RAX account.

The plan is to replace devstack-centos7 with this image globally once
we've got it stable.

Add an experimental job to use this new node for testing (devstack
should be able to bootstrap itself on these types of nodes).

Change-Id: I02fd98f5df7f90aa5d50666166b5c736f6f06aaf
Depends-On: I2956aaa49ba3137a799f97e0983ab4b7c93a0a0c

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-13 20:56:42.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Extend dicts with original model in create/update

This adjusts the logic in ML2 create port and create
network to use the original DB object created rather
than attempting to retrieve it from the DB again.
This eliminates the race window where the object could
be deleted out from underneath the create operations
resulting in a 404.

To achieve this it adds a create_port_db and
create_network_db method to db_base_plugin_v2 that
returns the original model instead of returning a
dictionary.

This also adds a skip to a unit test that was using DB
events to trigger a rollback and retry. This test was
causing failures with a FlushError conflict between an
SQL alchemy new instance and a persistent instance in
the session. This bug is fixed in the follow-up patch.

Closes-Bug: #1556139
Related-Bug: #1556178
Change-Id: I3c4b4cb4f63236fca24abaf58881879c2d5657fa
'}]
commit_message:
Extend dicts with original model in create/update

This adjusts the logic in ML2 create port and create
network to use the original DB object created rather
than attempting to retrieve it from the DB again.
This eliminates the race window where the object could
be deleted out from underneath the create operations
resulting in a 404.

To achieve this it adds a create_port_db and
create_network_db method to db_base_plugin_v2 that
returns the original model instead of returning a
dictionary.

This also adds a skip to a unit test that was using DB
events to trigger a rollback and retry. This test was
causing failures with a FlushError conflict between an
SQL alchemy new instance and a persistent instance in
the session. This bug is fixed in the follow-up patch.

Closes-Bug: #1556139
Related-Bug: #1556178
Change-Id: I3c4b4cb4f63236fca24abaf58881879c2d5657fa

This converts a notes section into easy commands to show
the user the files that should have been generated.

commit_message:
Fix 500 error if 'offset' is out of range

If large value is passed as offset to snapshots, volumes,
backups, consistencygroups and qos_specs list api then it
throws 500 internal server error.

Moved existing validate_integer() method from
cinder.api.openstack.wsgi.Controller to cinder.utils so
that it can also be used for validating offset param for
integer value in _get_offset_param() method and return 400
error if value is out of range.

Please refer:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1535708/comments/1

APIImpact: Return 400 status code if offset is out of range.

Closes-Bug: #1535708
Change-Id: I07a5292645f24c381217d43b71510b3352964b8b

commit_message:
Support for passing CA certificate in Ironic Glance Communication

Currently Ironic doesn't pass any certificate down for verifying
https connections in glance. New ironic config parameter
'glance_cafile' is added to [glance] section in ironic.conf to
pass the certificate down for https connection in glance.

Change-Id: I29e134d70addb16cd65dbd9c8038a23e76a57016

commit_message:
rbd: Change capacity calculation from integer to float

The current capacity calculation in the rbd driver use old
c-style integer calculation while e.g. the scheduler
_weigh_object function uses float, therefore calculate
capacity information in float with 2 digits precision for
Gb sizes.

Closes-Bug: #1508340

Change-Id: I1a731c7606a7dee0295b1604b582447d2da6e750
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

commit_message:
check for ovs agent is running on a host

while retreving the information from port details which belongs to specific host,
we are checking whether ovs agent is running on that host or not. if not,
exception is raised saying ovs agent not found in the host.

Closes-Bug:1515877

Change-Id: I23fccd8751ce791e1c6fd6920a0510c943714126

subject: Implement security group - Neutron plugin part
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-14 02:37:30.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/network/exceptions.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_security_groups.py', 'tricircle/network/security_groups.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_plugin.py', 'tricircle/tests/base.py', 'tricircle/network/plugin.py'], 'message': 'Implement security group - Neutron plugin part

The task Neutron plugin needs to finish for security group
functionality is simple. When a rule is created or deleted
in a security group, it just updates the corresponding
bottom security group. Also, creating or deleting a rule
with "remote_group_id and changing rules in default
security group will be rejected by plugin.

Currently this task runs in synchronous way. Later it can
be implemented in asynchronous way for better response time.

Change-Id: Ibbf46c2e91382986c02324d86bc22887e93267eb
'}]
commit_message:
Implement security group - Neutron plugin part

The task Neutron plugin needs to finish for security group
functionality is simple. When a rule is created or deleted
in a security group, it just updates the corresponding
bottom security group. Also, creating or deleting a rule
with "remote_group_id and changing rules in default
security group will be rejected by plugin.

Currently this task runs in synchronous way. Later it can
be implemented in asynchronous way for better response time.

Change-Id: Ibbf46c2e91382986c02324d86bc22887e93267eb

subject: Explicitly exclude tests from bandit scan
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-13 04:01:47.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Explicitly exclude tests from bandit scan

Now that the bandit linter runs without a bandit.yaml specified,
it should exclude the tests directory similar to how it did before
in the bandit.yaml.

The reason this has not caused a problem yet is because bandit is
still finding a config bandit.yaml in .tox/pep8/etc/bandit/bandit.yaml.
But in a newer version of bandit this will not be the case.

Change-Id: Ic2d6d5da7083936eb364f56fb23e09b5dbccebae
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly exclude tests from bandit scan

Now that the bandit linter runs without a bandit.yaml specified,
it should exclude the tests directory similar to how it did before
in the bandit.yaml.

The reason this has not caused a problem yet is because bandit is
still finding a config bandit.yaml in .tox/pep8/etc/bandit/bandit.yaml.
But in a newer version of bandit this will not be the case.

Change-Id: Ic2d6d5da7083936eb364f56fb23e09b5dbccebae

commit_message:
Explicitly exclude tests from bandit scan

Now that the bandit linter runs without a bandit.yaml specified,
it should exclude the tests directory similar to how it did before
in the bandit.yaml.

The reason this has not caused a problem yet is because bandit is
still finding a config bandit.yaml in .tox/pep8/etc/bandit/bandit.yaml.
But in a newer version of bandit this will not be the case.

Change-Id: I66dc7c2b826cf6e061fc6abc368c2be00ab2d202

subject: Implement security group - Nova API gateway part
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-14 01:48:23.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/common/lock_handle.py', 'tricircle/common/constants.py', 'tricircle/common/resource_handle.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/nova_apigw/controllers/test_server.py', 'tricircle/nova_apigw/controllers/server.py'], 'message': 'Implement security group - Nova API gateway part

Nova API gateway needs to finish two tasks for security group
functionality. One is to create security group in bottom pod if
it does not exist. Only when the user boot a server can we know
which pod to create the security group. The other one is to
handle default security group. We decide to replace the default
"remote group" rules with several "remote ip prefix" rules.
Each rule points to a CIDR of one of the project's subnets.
Since the collection of subnets may change, we need to update
bottom security group rules.

Currently these two tasks both run in synchronous way. For
better response time the second task can be implemented in
asynchronous way later.

Neutron plugin part for security group functionality will be
covered in next patch.

Change-Id: I1822ff16e3dfc2a89c34f7833adcc1ad1d952462
'}]
commit_message:
Implement security group - Nova API gateway part

Nova API gateway needs to finish two tasks for security group
functionality. One is to create security group in bottom pod if
it does not exist. Only when the user boot a server can we know
which pod to create the security group. The other one is to
handle default security group. We decide to replace the default
"remote group" rules with several "remote ip prefix" rules.
Each rule points to a CIDR of one of the project's subnets.
Since the collection of subnets may change, we need to update
bottom security group rules.

Currently these two tasks both run in synchronous way. For
better response time the second task can be implemented in
asynchronous way later.

Neutron plugin part for security group functionality will be
covered in next patch.

Change-Id: I1822ff16e3dfc2a89c34f7833adcc1ad1d952462

commit_message:
centos-minimal does not provide base

The "base" element is included by default, and if centos-minimal tries
to provide it then we die because two elements are providing the same
thing.

Change-Id: I2956aaa49ba3137a799f97e0983ab4b7c93a0a0c

commit_message:
Remove reference to log_format configuration option

oslo.log deprecated configuration option log_format, and is being
removed.  References to this in openstack-manuals should also
be removed to reflect this.

Change-Id: I0ac450e4a48f554dbaeb100f09226522930606e2

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-13 23:22:40.000000000', 'files': ['docker/base/apt_preferences'], 'message': "Properly pin ceph

Ubuntu is a bit different than centos. We aren't pinning a single ceph
verion because we cannot. We can however pin to a particular repo,
but we were not due to formating. This fixes that formating and pins
to a specific repo.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2f6c4cd2f7d51652dc2729c0ab384165151e94e2
"}]
commit_message:
Properly pin ceph

Ubuntu is a bit different than centos. We aren't pinning a single ceph
verion because we cannot. We can however pin to a particular repo,
but we were not due to formating. This fixes that formating and pins
to a specific repo.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I2f6c4cd2f7d51652dc2729c0ab384165151e94e2

subject: Add operation retry for zookeeper
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-13 04:35:00.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/common/utils.py', 'dragonflow/db/drivers/zookeeper_db_driver.py'], 'message': 'Add operation retry for zookeeper

When zookeeper works hard on node updates, the timeout may happen
between kazoo client and Zookeeper server. Zookeeper will raise
SessionExpiredException under high load.

This commit introduces a db-retry operation which is borrowed
from oslo.db project. When the expected exceptions are raised,
it will catch them and retry the operation.

Change-Id: I60e19b334aed19153966d4f7f6bfd411d49f8329
Closes-Bug: #1549154
'}]
commit_message:
Add operation retry for zookeeper

When zookeeper works hard on node updates, the timeout may happen
between kazoo client and Zookeeper server. Zookeeper will raise
SessionExpiredException under high load.

This commit introduces a db-retry operation which is borrowed
from oslo.db project. When the expected exceptions are raised,
it will catch them and retry the operation.

Change-Id: I60e19b334aed19153966d4f7f6bfd411d49f8329
Closes-Bug: #1549154

subject: Support db clean-up in df-db script and unstack
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-09 07:42:01.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/cli/df_db.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': "Support db clean-up in df-db script and unstack

The problem for unstack is that it doesn't clean
all the data in df db. It makes debugging more difficult
because the useless data are always increased and fill up
the df db for each stack.sh deployment.

This commit adds a cleanup function in df-db script and
calls it in unstack.

Change-Id: Ic706c1c71af86355dbc24395b974f3ff1efc35e8
Closes-Bug: #1548437
"}]
commit_message:
Support db clean-up in df-db script and unstack

The problem for unstack is that it doesn't clean
all the data in df db. It makes debugging more difficult
because the useless data are always increased and fill up
the df db for each stack.sh deployment.

This commit adds a cleanup function in df-db script and
calls it in unstack.

Change-Id: Ic706c1c71af86355dbc24395b974f3ff1efc35e8
Closes-Bug: #1548437

commit_message:
Fix lbaas-lb-status when health monitor disabled

When a health monitor has been disabled via admin-state-up=False
the neutron lbaas-loadbalancer-status command will fail.

This patch corrects the improper variable assignment causing this
failure.

Change-Id: Ibbfe670ee868ee0fb2d5a64f1a41b4e810c190eb
Closes-Bug: #1556528

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-12-22 06:08:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_taas/services/taas/drivers/linux/ovs_taas.py'], 'message': '[WIP]Add reserved stamps to notify flows created by other than ovs agent.

Flows without a stamp shoud not be deleted by ovs agent.
This patch modifies not to delete flows created by other than ovs
agent.

Coordination of stamps is required to avoid conflicts of the cookie
with other neutron subprojects.

Change-Id: I152e1c3f8745a10d3f383671dfd33cb3f24f374e
Closes-Bug: #1525775
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP]Add reserved stamps to notify flows created by other than ovs agent.

Flows without a stamp shoud not be deleted by ovs agent.
This patch modifies not to delete flows created by other than ovs
agent.

Coordination of stamps is required to avoid conflicts of the cookie
with other neutron subprojects.

Change-Id: I152e1c3f8745a10d3f383671dfd33cb3f24f374e
Closes-Bug: #1525775

The Django version is set to [Django>=1.8,<1.9 # BSD]
in the global-requirements.txt of OpenStack/Requirements.
The tox.ini should remove the py27dj17 like Horizon.
The Django version in the requirement.txt should be updated.

Closes-Bug: #1552124

commit_message:
Remove py27dj17 from tox.ini

The Django version is set to [Django>=1.8,<1.9 # BSD]
in the global-requirements.txt of OpenStack/Requirements.
The tox.ini should remove the py27dj17 like Horizon.
The Django version in the requirement.txt should be updated.

Change-Id: Ib0af7d45ac4ac6e412dd4cb7091c113f5a53ffcf
Closes-Bug: #1552124

We should fix following styles in table views for Mitaka Horizon.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246625/

Except followings, because Magnum-UI uses Magic-Search.

commit_message:
Fix styles of table views

We should fix following styles in table views for Mitaka Horizon.
This patch fixes these styles according to following html file in
patch.

/openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/table/images-table.html
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/246625/

Except followings, because Magnum-UI uses Magic-Search.
- position of batch action buttons

In M cycle, Horizon seems not to be going to fix styles of batch
actions considering with Magic-Search.

Change-Id: Ia8a91e18848089fb05dd7f9613b904ae29dedcd6
Closes-Bug: #1553936

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-09 07:05:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': 'Remove those unnecessary statements "return True"

The reasons to remove them:
* These asynchronous API is not necessary to return a value.
* We do not see the purpose of the statements, because it always
  returns true regardless of success or failure.

These statements are unnecessary and misleading, this commit we will
remove these "return True" (Or just remove "True" if it's not at the
end of a function, in order not to change the execution path).

Affected methods:
* delete_volume
* delete_snapshot
* delete_consistencygroup
* update_consistencygroup
* delete_cgsnapshot

Closes-Bug: #1533997
Change-Id: I38bac64b9eb1be6a4756cfcd3894615d2b849551
'}]
commit_message:
Remove those unnecessary statements "return True"

The reasons to remove them:
* These asynchronous API is not necessary to return a value.
* We do not see the purpose of the statements, because it always
  returns true regardless of success or failure.

These statements are unnecessary and misleading, this commit we will
remove these "return True" (Or just remove "True" if it's not at the
end of a function, in order not to change the execution path).

Affected methods:
* delete_volume
* delete_snapshot
* delete_consistencygroup
* update_consistencygroup
* delete_cgsnapshot

Closes-Bug: #1533997
Change-Id: I38bac64b9eb1be6a4756cfcd3894615d2b849551

subject: [WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-13 22:07:04.000000000', 'files': ['lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': "[WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination

There was an attempt before:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/8c03a6db6c0396099e7425834998da5478a1df7c,n,z

But the lower threshold was just too low (0.5). We should set it to
1/2 the time of the the rpc_response_timeout which is set to 60 seconds.

In the specific bug, nova api calls nova compute which calls nova
network which fails because a consumer went AWOL (when grenade stopped
the old side and started the new side). Since nova network waited
the full 60 seconds the rest of the previous calls time out. At least
with 30 seconds, there's a chance for the retry to succeed and
the responses flow back.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243845/

Depends-On: I55f3c4c8cef040a9dd594a658c8b3e0fd900ba60
Change-Id: I062bdab1f360b08ec97bd81b26d0dd28f211ac48
Closes-Bug: #1545002
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination

There was an attempt before:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/8c03a6db6c0396099e7425834998da5478a1df7c,n,z

But the lower threshold was just too low (0.5). We should set it to
1/2 the time of the the rpc_response_timeout which is set to 60 seconds.

In the specific bug, nova api calls nova compute which calls nova
network which fails because a consumer went AWOL (when grenade stopped
the old side and started the new side). Since nova network waited
the full 60 seconds the rest of the previous calls time out. At least
with 30 seconds, there's a chance for the retry to succeed and
the responses flow back.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243845/

Depends-On: I55f3c4c8cef040a9dd594a658c8b3e0fd900ba60
Change-Id: I062bdab1f360b08ec97bd81b26d0dd28f211ac48
Closes-Bug: #1545002

subject: yum-minimal: clear our rpm/dnf/yum data in chroot
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 03:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['elements/yum-minimal/root.d/08-yum-chroot'], 'message': 'yum-minimal: clear our rpm/dnf/yum data in chroot

I have seem some occasional odd failures coming from the "dnf -y
update" done by elements/base/install.d/00-up-to-date.

dnf seems to sometimes think a package is not installed when it really
is.  It then seems to try and re-install them, but notices they are
installed, and then bails with a failure exit [1].  The packages that
seem to cause this vary, but the common thread is that they seem to
have all been installed during the initial phase of installing the
package manager in the chroot.

I suspect that when we are building the chroot, we do our initial
install with the "external" yum & rpm.  Then we start using the
dnf/yum in the chroot, but we're actually using meta-data created by
the *external* tools -- which could be vastly different versions or
who-knows-what.  While I honestly I don't have an exact root cause,
empirically I've found rebuilding the rpm db always seems to fix
things up.

So this change takes care to rebuild the rpm db with the chroot
version of rpm, and clear out the package metadata for a refresh with
"update".  This should hopefully put us in a consistent state.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/487356/

Change-Id: I565df23897ae511356c4861fdbe63823fa6b6ff9
'}]
commit_message:
yum-minimal: clear our rpm/dnf/yum data in chroot

I have seem some occasional odd failures coming from the "dnf -y
update" done by elements/base/install.d/00-up-to-date.

dnf seems to sometimes think a package is not installed when it really
is.  It then seems to try and re-install them, but notices they are
installed, and then bails with a failure exit [1].  The packages that
seem to cause this vary, but the common thread is that they seem to
have all been installed during the initial phase of installing the
package manager in the chroot.

I suspect that when we are building the chroot, we do our initial
install with the "external" yum & rpm.  Then we start using the
dnf/yum in the chroot, but we're actually using meta-data created by
the *external* tools -- which could be vastly different versions or
who-knows-what.  While I honestly I don't have an exact root cause,
empirically I've found rebuilding the rpm db always seems to fix
things up.

So this change takes care to rebuild the rpm db with the chroot
version of rpm, and clear out the package metadata for a refresh with
"update".  This should hopefully put us in a consistent state.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/487356/

Change-Id: I565df23897ae511356c4861fdbe63823fa6b6ff9

commit_message:
Change Fail to Failed in error messages

To maintain proper error messaging, this fix changes the usage of
'Fail' to 'Failed' in two separate error messages. This change will
make these error messages consistent with other messaging.

Closes-Bug: #1549453
Change-Id: I961d341ce61eaceb062e9c0318d1c7b32e4d5263

subject: Fix time related check in rejection test
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-03 01:15:33.000000000', 'files': ['futurist/tests/test_executors.py'], 'message': 'Fix time related check in rejection test

Instead of using time functions to delay submissions
to validate that rejection fails use an event instead
and use it to force the needed threads to block up so
that rejection will always happen (even with time
changes).

Closes-bug: #1552232

Change-Id: Ib688dccd8eda8c11b71b4aa36904ee67d2f93889
'}]
commit_message:
Fix time related check in rejection test

Instead of using time functions to delay submissions
to validate that rejection fails use an event instead
and use it to force the needed threads to block up so
that rejection will always happen (even with time
changes).

Closes-bug: #1552232

Change-Id: Ib688dccd8eda8c11b71b4aa36904ee67d2f93889

subject: Use primitive type name in ValueError for Object field coerce failure
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-08 19:48:31.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py'], 'message': "Use primitive type name in ValueError for Object field coerce failure

When the Object field coerce method doesn't get an object, the
type put into the ValueError message is the empty string, which is
not useful.

This change uses the type name from the value so the error has
useful details.

Change-Id: I45386cfda17243a82864780da1701d3b35432ae0
Closes-Bug: #1552480
"}]
commit_message:
Use primitive type name in ValueError for Object field coerce failure

When the Object field coerce method doesn't get an object, the
type put into the ValueError message is the empty string, which is
not useful.

This change uses the type name from the value so the error has
useful details.

Change-Id: I45386cfda17243a82864780da1701d3b35432ae0
Closes-Bug: #1552480

commit_message:
Added availability zones to nodes

The availability zones always default for minion and gateways
nodes. It is not present in the Kilo version of k8s.

In this patch, I added the availability zones to the kilo
branch of murano-apps.

Change-Id: I7819fa788f030bc55af03b78e7ed6167458afab0
Closes-Bug: #1556119

commit_message:
Delete tempest fork

A while ago we copied Tempest networking API tests in to the Neutron
repo, and along came thousands of lines of code of Tempest testing
infrastructure (neutron.tests.tempest). For a while we periodically
refreshed our fork via: tools/copy_api_tests_from_tempest.sh

It's time to remove tempest fork[1] and use tempest_lib when possible or
tempest itself for code not moved to tempest-lib instead of duplicating,
forking tempest as done in Neutron, Manila & Ironic.

This change is based on the similar work done in Neutron tree[2].

[1] neutron_lbaas.tests.tempest.lib
[2] I4f9193dfe26f2d36985cb480a98709ec182a2f7b

Co-Authored-By: Franklin Naval <franklin.naval@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1536852
Change-Id: I516b37d45200cc120a929ecd9011ff8bb4c45d9f

subject: Don't attempt to test with 0.6c11 with Py3
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-10 05:33:40.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_integration.py'], 'message': "Don't attempt to test with 0.6c11 with Py3

Setuptools 0.6c11 is ancient, and doesn't install on Py3, so don't
attempt to do so.  We don't test Py3 in the gate with integration, so
this is a noop there, however this means if we do so in the future
this won't bubble up as a failure.  It also allows me to run this block
of integration tests with Py3 in addtion to Py27 locally.

Change-Id: I1dc6eb7591be847573231ca1056c2cd31b2f673a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't attempt to test with 0.6c11 with Py3

Setuptools 0.6c11 is ancient, and doesn't install on Py3, so don't
attempt to do so.  We don't test Py3 in the gate with integration, so
this is a noop there, however this means if we do so in the future
this won't bubble up as a failure.  It also allows me to run this block
of integration tests with Py3 in addtion to Py27 locally.

Change-Id: I1dc6eb7591be847573231ca1056c2cd31b2f673a

Simulator: store results in JSON format

This patch introduces new parameter --json <file name>.
When it is specified the simulator stores stats in JSON file.

subject: Simulator: calculate message latency statistics
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-10 10:57:29.000000000', 'files': ['tools/simulator.py'], 'message': 'Simulator: calculate message latency statistics

Calculate message latency: for RPC calls on both server-side and
on client-side (round-trip); for RPC cast and NOTIFY on server-side
only.

The message is extended with metadata: sequence id, creation time,
reception time and return time (for RPC calls). For every message
the metadata is stored into MessageStatCollector. To reduce memory
consumption the collector aggregates stats on every second and can
print the ongoing stats to stdout. At the finish the overall stats
are printed.

NOTIFY tests are changed to be similar to RPC:
 * use pre-generated messages
 * parameter "-w WAIT_BEFORE_ANSWER" for processing delay
 * parameter "--requeue" to re-queue new messages (only those that
   miss the cache)

Change-Id: I4c2fc11bfaee17b6825cdc7d6edf07b8e91ef83a
'}]
commit_message:
Simulator: calculate message latency statistics

Calculate message latency: for RPC calls on both server-side and
on client-side (round-trip); for RPC cast and NOTIFY on server-side
only.

The message is extended with metadata: sequence id, creation time,
reception time and return time (for RPC calls). For every message
the metadata is stored into MessageStatCollector. To reduce memory
consumption the collector aggregates stats on every second and can
print the ongoing stats to stdout. At the finish the overall stats
are printed.

NOTIFY tests are changed to be similar to RPC:
 * use pre-generated messages
 * parameter "-w WAIT_BEFORE_ANSWER" for processing delay
 * parameter "--requeue" to re-queue new messages (only those that
   miss the cache)

Change-Id: I4c2fc11bfaee17b6825cdc7d6edf07b8e91ef83a

subject: CORS Middleware now honors upstream Vary header
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-09 15:28:42.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_middleware/cors.py', 'oslo_middleware/tests/test_cors.py'], 'message': "CORS Middleware now honors upstream Vary header

If an upstream middleware or server returns a 'Vary' header, the
CORS middleware will honor that header and append its own,
rather than overwriting it.

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.4

Change-Id: I422cf1723dca7e1ecf0ce863b389f125d4f813bb
"}]
commit_message:
CORS Middleware now honors upstream Vary header

If an upstream middleware or server returns a 'Vary' header, the
CORS middleware will honor that header and append its own,
rather than overwriting it.

https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.4

Change-Id: I422cf1723dca7e1ecf0ce863b389f125d4f813bb

commit_message:
Fix for glance_metadata during volume migration

This patch allows to transfer glance_metadata together with volume
during the migration process, when the volume is created from the
image.

Co-Authored-By: Michal Dulko <michal.dulko@intel.com>
Change-Id: Ifee5f2c53865076f43556d9dd6b6cbef77494bc8
Closes-Bug: 1538926

subject: [WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-13 18:20:53.000000000', 'files': ['lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': "[WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination

There was an attempt before:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/8c03a6db6c0396099e7425834998da5478a1df7c,n,z

But the lower threshold was just too low (0.5). We should set it to
1/2 the time of the the rpc_response_timeout which is set to 60 seconds.

In the specific bug, nova api calls nova compute which calls nova
network which fails because a consumer went AWOL (when grenade stopped
the old side and started the new side). Since nova network waited
the full 60 seconds the rest of the previous calls time out. At least
with 30 seconds, there's a chance for the retry to succeed and
the responses flow back.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243845/

Change-Id: I062bdab1f360b08ec97bd81b26d0dd28f211ac47
Closes-Bug: #1545002
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination

There was an attempt before:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/8c03a6db6c0396099e7425834998da5478a1df7c,n,z

But the lower threshold was just too low (0.5). We should set it to
1/2 the time of the the rpc_response_timeout which is set to 60 seconds.

In the specific bug, nova api calls nova compute which calls nova
network which fails because a consumer went AWOL (when grenade stopped
the old side and started the new side). Since nova network waited
the full 60 seconds the rest of the previous calls time out. At least
with 30 seconds, there's a chance for the retry to succeed and
the responses flow back.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/243845/

Change-Id: I062bdab1f360b08ec97bd81b26d0dd28f211ac47
Closes-Bug: #1545002

subject: Use fstrim to prep the block device
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-13 16:25:00.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'lib/img-functions', 'doc/source/developer/design.rst'], 'message': 'Use fstrim to prep the block device

This cuts the image size down alot, esspecially if there were lots of
small file deletes.

The fstrim utility is in the util-linux package and should be on
most all systems. fstrim also works with XFS, ext4, btrfs, etc
prodiving the kernel is new enough.

A reduction of 25% or more in size is common.

Change-Id: I269b4416be450369616f9b8e030f84c30e329804
'}]
commit_message:
Use fstrim to prep the block device

This cuts the image size down alot, esspecially if there were lots of
small file deletes.

The fstrim utility is in the util-linux package and should be on
most all systems. fstrim also works with XFS, ext4, btrfs, etc
prodiving the kernel is new enough.

A reduction of 25% or more in size is common.

Change-Id: I269b4416be450369616f9b8e030f84c30e329804

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-12 21:25:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_api.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', 'neutron/db/api.py'], 'message': "Retry port create/update on duplicate db records

Even though we have a duplicate IP check before creating an IP
allocation, there is a window between when that check is completed
and when the record is committed to the database. During this window,
another thread or server may use the same IP address, which will result
in the database commit failing with a DBDuplicateEntry exception.

This patch adds a decorator to convert the exception into a
RetryRequest, which will be caught at the API layer to start the
operation over, at which point the normal duplicate check will find
the IP and return the correct error to the user.

This was done instead of trying to convert the DBDuplicate to the
correct exception since it's on commit and there are possibly many
different sources of the duplicate record beyond the IP allocation
(depending on what mechanism drivers did during pre-commit, etc).
By retrying the request, we ensure that the prechecks run again that
will raise the appropriate exception.

Change-Id: I37a964497bf60a61bc49bdeec94a008f167c384f
Closes-Bug: #1534447
(cherry picked from commit f67fc3cb08ce4f0e6fc685801a243fe68503578e)
"}]
commit_message:
Retry port create/update on duplicate db records

Even though we have a duplicate IP check before creating an IP
allocation, there is a window between when that check is completed
and when the record is committed to the database. During this window,
another thread or server may use the same IP address, which will result
in the database commit failing with a DBDuplicateEntry exception.

This patch adds a decorator to convert the exception into a
RetryRequest, which will be caught at the API layer to start the
operation over, at which point the normal duplicate check will find
the IP and return the correct error to the user.

This was done instead of trying to convert the DBDuplicate to the
correct exception since it's on commit and there are possibly many
different sources of the duplicate record beyond the IP allocation
(depending on what mechanism drivers did during pre-commit, etc).
By retrying the request, we ensure that the prechecks run again that
will raise the appropriate exception.

Change-Id: I37a964497bf60a61bc49bdeec94a008f167c384f
Closes-Bug: #1534447
(cherry picked from commit f67fc3cb08ce4f0e6fc685801a243fe68503578e)

commit_message:
DRBD driver: resize volume if cloned image is larger

Extend volume if during create_cloned_volume() the new
volume is larger than the image it was cloned from.

Closes-Bug: #1554756

Change-Id: Id43e18c32c241a30cb35effe1fab8effe4517ba9
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>

commit_message:
Allow clone volume with different size

Previously when cloning new volume, VNX driver ignores the size
of new volume, and take the size of source volume.

This fix will allow new size to be set for new cloned volume.

Closes-bug: #1554776
Change-Id: Ib75e1b5caa434746864b66bb79b532120aed0f20

The unmarshalling function was not aware of the data
structure used by update_fdb_entries, so it would not
setup PortInfo named tuples in the 'before' and 'after'
fields. This would break the fdb_chg_ip_tun function
which expected to be able to use named attributes.

This patch adjusts the unmarshalling function to be aware
of this datastrucure.

This has likely been broken since the change that added

It probably went undetected for so long because the exception
will only be observed when the updated entry does not have
an agent IP that matches the local agent's (i.e. not single-node).

commit_message:
Unmarshall portinfo on update_fdb_entries calls

The unmarshalling function was not aware of the data
structure used by update_fdb_entries, so it would not
setup PortInfo named tuples in the 'before' and 'after'
fields. This would break the fdb_chg_ip_tun function
which expected to be able to use named attributes.

This patch adjusts the unmarshalling function to be aware
of this datastrucure.

This has likely been broken since the change that added
named tuples here: I7f8c93b0e12ee0179bb23dfbb3a3d814615b1c2e
It probably went undetected for so long because the exception
will only be observed when the updated entry does not have
an agent IP that matches the local agent's (i.e. not single-node).
Even in a multi-node environment, this would only trigger an
error when the fixed_ips of a port changed so it wouldn't show
up in a normal port wiring life-cycle.

Closes-Bug: #1538387
Change-Id: I0aacb3af9ebd160ebfb801f77b186075303c3df5
(cherry picked from commit 8dcf39aae7a099e01bd322891526c134e87e6b1b)

Currently most OpenStack code is linted, but YAML files are not.

To prevent errors (key duplicates, non-sense syntaxes) and cosmetic
problems, this patch enables YAML linting in tox tests using the
yamllint tool [1].

Once merged, it should avoid commits like:
- b005206  Fix trailing whitespace
- ...

[1]: http://yamllint.readthedocs.org/

Note: Indentation checking is disabled, but can be easily enabled in the

'}]
commit_message:
Lint YAML files

Currently most OpenStack code is linted, but YAML files are not.

To prevent errors (key duplicates, non-sense syntaxes) and cosmetic
problems, this patch enables YAML linting in tox tests using the
yamllint tool [1].

Once merged, it should avoid commits like:
- b005206  Fix trailing whitespace
- ...

[1]: http://yamllint.readthedocs.org/

Note: Indentation checking is disabled, but can be easily enabled in the
future if there is a need for it.

Change-Id: Ic70439c77fbb7a58d8f53dd4d3f1d146d0507d32

commit_message:
Fix linting errors in YAML files

Currently most OpenStack code is linted, but YAML files are not. As a
result, sometimes YAML problems enter the code base (for instance, the
yamllint tool detected key duplications in other OpenStack projects).

This patch corrects a few problems detected by yamllint [1]; it's
a preparation for change Ic70439c77fbb7a58d8f53dd4d3f1d146d0507d32 that
enables linting in tox tests.

[1]: http://yamllint.readthedocs.org/

Change-Id: I9faeba39394890631d8c9244ee255c444429f2af

subject: [WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-12 02:19:08.000000000', 'files': ['lib/rpc_backend'], 'message': "[WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination

There was an attempt before:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/8c03a6db6c0396099e7425834998da5478a1df7c,n,z

But the lower threshold was just too low (0.5). We should set it to
1/2 the time of the the rpc_response_timeout which is set to 60 seconds.

In the specific bug, nova api calls nova compute which calls nova
network which fails because a consumer went AWOL (when grenade stopped
the old side and started the new side). Since nova network waited
the full 60 seconds the rest of the previous calls time out. At least
with 30 seconds, there's a chance for the retry to succeed and
the responses flow back.

Closes-Bug: #1545002
Change-Id: I94a1e7393a3ccfc7c2cdd7f1489644b50a582d4b
"}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Rabbit - Lower retry timeout for missing destination

There was an attempt before:
https://review.openstack.org/#/q/8c03a6db6c0396099e7425834998da5478a1df7c,n,z

But the lower threshold was just too low (0.5). We should set it to
1/2 the time of the the rpc_response_timeout which is set to 60 seconds.

In the specific bug, nova api calls nova compute which calls nova
network which fails because a consumer went AWOL (when grenade stopped
the old side and started the new side). Since nova network waited
the full 60 seconds the rest of the previous calls time out. At least
with 30 seconds, there's a chance for the retry to succeed and
the responses flow back.

Closes-Bug: #1545002
Change-Id: I94a1e7393a3ccfc7c2cdd7f1489644b50a582d4b

UnableToFailOver and InvalidReplicationTarget do not save the state
of replication_status currently. This patch adds host.save() in
order to write the change to the db.

In addition, the manager should honor the current replication state

Change-Id: I01af6d70539e518936c74e425c3fad60f4b94581

commit_message:
Fix up failover_host exceptions to preserve states

UnableToFailOver and InvalidReplicationTarget do not save the state
of replication_status currently. This patch adds host.save() in
order to write the change to the db.

In addition, the manager should honor the current replication state
of the host when InvalidReplicationTarget is raised instead of forcing
it into 'enabled' state.

Change-Id: I01af6d70539e518936c74e425c3fad60f4b94581

commit_message:
Catch all errors in Mock detector

It turns out that some modules may throw exceptions
other than ImportError from their class members.
The mock detector should ignore those.

Change-Id: I513c573982250e24b94ec5e649cf2c9e2799334c
Closes-Bug: 1524918
(cherry picked from commit e8d9a3647acc4841f401cb650c5649e87b0a8d6f)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-03-11 13:58:23.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/log_in_dashboard.rst'], 'message': '[user-guide]Update the content of log-in to the dashboard

According to this commit 0e2337ec211f2ce009f594a16f458e4dc55cb144,
the mutil-domain credentials is set by default for Liberty. But the
End User Guide covers various release. Therefore, we need enter the
domain, user name and password, if the cloud enables the multi-domain
credentials.

Change-Id: Icb441717fc49b039c79eef608b6efa89de6e5c1b
Closes-Bug: #1554906
'}]
commit_message:
[user-guide]Update the content of log-in to the dashboard

According to this commit 0e2337ec211f2ce009f594a16f458e4dc55cb144,
the mutil-domain credentials is set by default for Liberty. But the
End User Guide covers various release. Therefore, we need enter the
domain, user name and password, if the cloud enables the multi-domain
credentials.

Change-Id: Icb441717fc49b039c79eef608b6efa89de6e5c1b
Closes-Bug: #1554906

commit_message:
Wrong link reference in "POST /v2/​{tenant_id}​/volumes" response table.

This patch repair the wrong link reference in "volume_type" description
in response parameters table of Block storage API v2.
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#createVolume.
The keyword with link reference: "Configure multiple-storage back ends".
The wrong link:
http://docs.openstack.org /admin-guide-cloud/blockstorage_multi_backend.html
The right link:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/blockstorage_multi_backend.html

Change-Id: I2e427e7cda19387449c3b9403c1c310be34719fa
Closes-Bug: #1555509

subject: [Orchestration API v1] Fix create_stack response params
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-10 20:25:39.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/orchestration-api/src/v1/orchestration-api.wadl'], 'message': '[Orchestration API v1] Fix create_stack response params

Contrary to the docs, but consistent with the sample, the response to a
stack_create does not contain all of the data from the input. It looks as
if the documentation from the request was accidentally duplicated into the
response, and the documentation for the environment and disable_rollback
options were added into the wrong section.

Also rewrote the documentation of the "rel" member of a link so that it is
less incomprehensible/wrong, and moved it to indicate that it is not a
top-level key in the output.

Change-Id: I6b940feea82ce5efaa934a1096f7f7fd46208387
'}]
commit_message:
[Orchestration API v1] Fix create_stack response params

Contrary to the docs, but consistent with the sample, the response to a
stack_create does not contain all of the data from the input. It looks as
if the documentation from the request was accidentally duplicated into the
response, and the documentation for the environment and disable_rollback
options were added into the wrong section.

Also rewrote the documentation of the "rel" member of a link so that it is
less incomprehensible/wrong, and moved it to indicate that it is not a
top-level key in the output.

Change-Id: I6b940feea82ce5efaa934a1096f7f7fd46208387

subject: Compute API v2.1 Servers - run an action has wrong API.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 04:00:53.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/docbkx/ch_compute-v2.1.xml'], 'message': 'Compute API v2.1 Servers - run an action has wrong API.

This patch add "Change administrative password" API to the Compute
API v2.1 Servers - run an action cluster.
In current documentation, there is no API between "Add (associate)
floating IP (addFloatingIp action)" and "Confirm resized server
(confirmResize action)", so the documentation displays wrong.
Related link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#addFloatingIp
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#confirmResize

Change-Id: Ia5e131f59252f7953b8443ad7dffd436ba33511a
Closes-Bug: #1555888
'}]
commit_message:
Compute API v2.1 Servers - run an action has wrong API.

This patch add "Change administrative password" API to the Compute
API v2.1 Servers - run an action cluster.
In current documentation, there is no API between "Add (associate)
floating IP (addFloatingIp action)" and "Confirm resized server
(confirmResize action)", so the documentation displays wrong.
Related link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#addFloatingIp
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-compute-v2.1.html#confirmResize

Change-Id: Ia5e131f59252f7953b8443ad7dffd436ba33511a
Closes-Bug: #1555888

subject: Block storage v2.0 Shows absolute limits missing response parameter.
revisions:

This patch add the "rate" parameter to response table when users
process showing absolute limits for a tenant in Block storage v2.0
API.
The "rate" parameter is defined as below:
 + rate:xsd:list: Rate-limit volume copy bandwidth, used to mitigate slow
 down of data access from the instances.
Related link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#showAbsoluteLimits

Change-Id: Ie76e71b1ba36d558cbb32fedddc88faefc8c1de8
Closes-Bug: #1555500
'}]
commit_message:
Block storage v2.0 Shows absolute limits missing response parameter.

This patch add the "rate" parameter to response table when users
process showing absolute limits for a tenant in Block storage v2.0
API.
The "rate" parameter is defined as below:
 + rate:xsd:list: Rate-limit volume copy bandwidth, used to mitigate slow
 down of data access from the instances.
Related link:
http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref-blockstorage-v2.html#showAbsoluteLimits

Change-Id: Ie76e71b1ba36d558cbb32fedddc88faefc8c1de8
Closes-Bug: #1555500

commit_message:
Retire devstack-trusty in favor of ubuntu-trusty

ubuntu-trusty is the new fancy built-with-dib image that we build once
and upload everywhere. We should use it for all the things we've been
using devstack-trusty for. Add it to the or list so that we can modify
the quota ratios and then finally remove devstack-trusty references.

Change-Id: Ie7705970b13df2e0bc5bd89a931c27e53628416f

commit_message:
The type of "virtual_interfaces" parameter is declared incorrectly

The type of "virtual_interfaces" parameter in response parameters table
is declared incorrectly when listing the virtual interfaces for an
instance using Compute API.
This patch changes this type from "xsd:string" to "xsd:list".

Change-Id: I2601ea4133022c08c6bd8b4386abc9466c2d0b6a
Closes-Bug: #1551116

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-03-01 03:20:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/ssh_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_ssh_utils.py'], 'message': 'Fix sshpool.remove code

Currently, sshpool.remove function under cinder/ssh_utils.py
is broken. The function tries to locate the passed in
sshclient object inside sshpool.free_items.

However, since the sshclient object is set to “None” at the
beginning, it never finds the object and ends up decrementing
 the current size, without actually removing the object.

Made the following changes to fix:
1. Removed reset to ‘None’ so that the attempt to locate object
goes through.
2. Fixed the code to use free_items.remove(ssh) to remove the ssh
object identified instead of free_items.pop(ssh)
3. Also updated the code to decrement current size only if a match
is found in free_items.
4. Added test case to test remove() of an ssh client that is in the
free_items
5. Added test case to test that remove code does not inadvertently
remove an object from the pool if no match is found.

Change-Id: I4871f4faeb1fc790325f274ab21dc42a8d71fb26
Closes-Bug: #1463557
'}]
commit_message:
Fix sshpool.remove code

Currently, sshpool.remove function under cinder/ssh_utils.py
is broken. The function tries to locate the passed in
sshclient object inside sshpool.free_items.

However, since the sshclient object is set to “None” at the
beginning, it never finds the object and ends up decrementing
 the current size, without actually removing the object.

Made the following changes to fix:
1. Removed reset to ‘None’ so that the attempt to locate object
goes through.
2. Fixed the code to use free_items.remove(ssh) to remove the ssh
object identified instead of free_items.pop(ssh)
3. Also updated the code to decrement current size only if a match
is found in free_items.
4. Added test case to test remove() of an ssh client that is in the
free_items
5. Added test case to test that remove code does not inadvertently
remove an object from the pool if no match is found.

Change-Id: I4871f4faeb1fc790325f274ab21dc42a8d71fb26

subject: [Orchestration API v1]: Fix fix to stack adopt/create parameters
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-10 20:25:39.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/orchestration-api/src/v1/orchestration-api.wadl'], 'message': '[Orchestration API v1]: Fix fix to stack adopt/create parameters

The patch f17d0437aa4c2f64d7062e02a99e047e25bf5d79 was intended to remove
the template and template_url request parameters from the stack adopt API
docs, but accidentally removed them from the stack create API docs instead.
This patch corrects the problem.

Change-Id: Idc3783280caa4b5d8fee797f03f214a3603d8dc2
'}]
commit_message:
[Orchestration API v1]: Fix fix to stack adopt/create parameters

The patch f17d0437aa4c2f64d7062e02a99e047e25bf5d79 was intended to remove
the template and template_url request parameters from the stack adopt API
docs, but accidentally removed them from the stack create API docs instead.
This patch corrects the problem.

Change-Id: Idc3783280caa4b5d8fee797f03f214a3603d8dc2

Closes-Bug: 1554741

commit_message:
Dell SC: create_cloned_volume didn't honor size

If the volume being created was larger than the cloned volume
the new volume was not being resized.

Change-Id: I43b9da93d8770a5630f7a6b2af2c164c3ed1f4ec
Closes-Bug: 1554741

subject: render-wiki-list: Only remove the TC if needed
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 05:57:27.000000000', 'files': ['tools/render-wiki-list.py'], 'message': 'render-wiki-list: Only remove the TC if needed

If the TC election hasn't been opened then render-wiki-list will fail with:
---
 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "tools/render-wiki-list.py", line 31, in <module>
     main(sys.argv)
   File "tools/render-wiki-list.py", line 17, in main
     candidates_list['projects'].remove('TC')
 ValueError: list.remove(x): x not in list
---

Fix that

Change-Id: I5292655d14871b2b3047be0d2720423acfdab9e3
'}]
commit_message:
render-wiki-list: Only remove the TC if needed

If the TC election hasn't been opened then render-wiki-list will fail with:
---
 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "tools/render-wiki-list.py", line 31, in <module>
     main(sys.argv)
   File "tools/render-wiki-list.py", line 17, in main
     candidates_list['projects'].remove('TC')
 ValueError: list.remove(x): x not in list
---

Fix that

Change-Id: I5292655d14871b2b3047be0d2720423acfdab9e3

subject: Use yaml keys to locate the project deliverables
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 05:35:59.000000000', 'files': ['tools/check-candidacy.py'], 'message': "Use yaml keys to locate the project deliverables

Due to the election setup and we can't trivially map the directory
names to project keys.  This wasn't caught during creation of the
election.  Rather then rename directories while the election is in
progress reverse the look up direction to map project keys =>
directories.

Change-Id: Ib9595d20202328f111bb9cce3c97147cd393f7b7
"}]
commit_message:
Use yaml keys to locate the project deliverables

Due to the election setup and we can't trivially map the directory
names to project keys.  This wasn't caught during creation of the
election.  Rather then rename directories while the election is in
progress reverse the look up direction to map project keys =>
directories.

Change-Id: Ib9595d20202328f111bb9cce3c97147cd393f7b7

commit_message:
Fix midonet/tap-as-a-service translations

Change I60550d10c72aeee9b320458b07eba07e92d9fd30 somehow got misapplied,
it setups up tap-as-a-service for translation instead of
networking-midonet.

Move the lines to the right project.

Change-Id: I109c214d02cafb2fef765d7e1dcac170b90111d8

subject: Enable showing multiple locations for ceph plugin
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-02-12 16:36:40.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ceph'], 'message': "Enable showing multiple locations for ceph plugin

Currently glance v2 doesn't allow to specify custom
locations for image by default, it returns 403.
To enable this 'show_multiple_locations' param must
be set to True.

When Nova is doing snapshots with Ceph it provides
location to activate image, which fails when we use
Glance v2.

To fix it we change the default param to True.
'show_image_direct_url' will be overridden.

Related to blueprint use-glance-v2-api

Change-Id: Id0f1c398b8b48f2ffc2488b29bc7cbd279069337
"}]
commit_message:
Enable showing multiple locations for ceph plugin

Currently glance v2 doesn't allow to specify custom
locations for image by default, it returns 403.
To enable this 'show_multiple_locations' param must
be set to True.

When Nova is doing snapshots with Ceph it provides
location to activate image, which fails when we use
Glance v2.

To fix it we change the default param to True.
'show_image_direct_url' will be overridden.

Related to blueprint use-glance-v2-api

Change-Id: Id0f1c398b8b48f2ffc2488b29bc7cbd279069337

subject: Make stub_gateway pass through headers
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-08 08:42:01.000000000', 'files': ['Engine/swift/storlet_gateway/storlet_stub_gateway.py'], 'message': 'Make stub_gateway pass through headers

Now, stub_gateway pass through body content, while it replaces metadata dict
by empty one.
This patch makes stub_gateway pass through metadata dict, to make sure it does
not change anything about response/request.

Change-Id: Ied7b4da178e9a444f0a5267c2fe872ad4df057cc
'}]
commit_message:
Make stub_gateway pass through headers

Now, stub_gateway pass through body content, while it replaces metadata dict
by empty one.
This patch makes stub_gateway pass through metadata dict, to make sure it does
not change anything about response/request.

Change-Id: Ied7b4da178e9a444f0a5267c2fe872ad4df057cc

commit_message:
Create NB_API after fork

Instead of using the same nb_api and the same
db client and publisher in all the Neutron workers, each
worker should have its own client and publisher.

Change-Id: I73db90862c08fe055328738c17276135433bfb54

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-08 17:39:51.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_dellfc.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_dellscapi.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_api.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_dellsc.py'], 'message': 'Dell SC: Incorrect values in REST API Login call

The Dell SC REST API driver (dell_storagecenter_api.py) could
specify the wrong api version header. On connection failure
the driver needs to parse the failure text to see if it is
the wrong value and try a second time.

Added the apiversion variable to the StorageCenterApiHelper
class so that this value only needs to be discovered once.

Updated open_connection appropriately.

Change-Id: Ibab6cf227f298b0fbf990aabcc674350a56c5439
Closes-Bug: 1548496
'}]
commit_message:
Dell SC: Incorrect values in REST API Login call

The Dell SC REST API driver (dell_storagecenter_api.py) could
specify the wrong api version header. On connection failure
the driver needs to parse the failure text to see if it is
the wrong value and try a second time.

Added the apiversion variable to the StorageCenterApiHelper
class so that this value only needs to be discovered once.

Updated open_connection appropriately.

Change-Id: Ibab6cf227f298b0fbf990aabcc674350a56c5439
Closes-Bug: 1548496

commit_message:
Moved CORS middleware configuration into oslo-config-generator

The default values needed for cinder's implementation of cors
middleware have been moved from paste.ini into the configuration
hooks provided by oslo.config. Furthermore, these values have been
added to cinder's default configuration parsing. This ensures
that if a value remains unset in cinder.conf, it will be set
to use sane defaults, and that an operator modifying the
configuration file will be presented with a default set of
necessary sane headers.

Depends-on: I658e54966c390b41e3b551dd9827606c2e013511
Change-Id: Ia8735d5952d7e03b6948f748afead13e6f890271
Closes-Bug: 1551836

subject: Fix dict.keys() compatibility for python 3
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10386, 'name': 'OpenDaylight CI', 'email': 'odl-openstack@opendaylight.org', 'username': 'odl-jenkins', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10692, 'name': 'Brocade Vyatta CI', 'email': 'DL-GRP-VYATTA-OSS@Brocade.com', 'username': 'brocade-oss-service', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14937, 'name': 'Tang Chen', 'email': 'imtangchen@163.com', 'username': 'tangchen'}, {'_account_id': 15752, 'name': 'Intel SR-IOV CI', 'email': 'sriov-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'sriovci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-12 08:41:47.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/api/v2/base.py', 'neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/dhcp/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/hacking/test_checks.py', 'neutron/agent/securitygroups_rpc.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/hooks/policy_enforcement.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py', 'neutron/db/quota/driver.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/native/commands.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py', 'neutron/agent/dhcp/agent.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_rpc_base.py', 'neutron/agent/ovsdb/api.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/mech_sriov/agent/eswitch_manager.py', 'neutron/services/bgp/agent/bgp_dragent.py', 'neutron/manager.py', 'neutron/pecan_wsgi/startup.py'], 'message': "Fix dict.keys() compatibility for python 3

In Python 2, dict.keys() will return a list. But in Python 3,
it will return an iterable. So we need to fix all the assumptions
that assuming dict.keys() is a list. They may be:

1. A function's return value which is expected to be a list
2. Anywhere dict.keys() is used as a list

We don't need to fix:

1. for xxx in dict.keys:
2. if dict.keys():
3. dict.keys() as a parameter of set.difference(), filter(), and so on.
4. Anywhere dict.keys() has been transformed to a set, or any other iterable.

Change-Id: I5ce81f57cafbb8b09b3f8c862af0b463450dcf04
Closes-Bug: #1556379
"}]
commit_message:
Fix dict.keys() compatibility for python 3

In Python 2, dict.keys() will return a list. But in Python 3,
it will return an iterable. So we need to fix all the assumptions
that assuming dict.keys() is a list. They may be:

1. A function's return value which is expected to be a list
2. Anywhere dict.keys() is used as a list

We don't need to fix:

1. for xxx in dict.keys:
2. if dict.keys():
3. dict.keys() as a parameter of set.difference(), filter(), and so on.
4. Anywhere dict.keys() has been transformed to a set, or any other iterable.

Change-Id: I5ce81f57cafbb8b09b3f8c862af0b463450dcf04
Closes-Bug: #1556379

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-10 18:50:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py'], 'message': "Move replication_status update to init_with_rpc

We were using host_init to read replication_status from the
driver and update the service entry in the DB.  It turns out
that on a fresh install this doesn't actually work, because
while we have multiple init methods for the backend, the
Service entry isn't actually created in a fresh deploy until
AFTER init_host.  The result was that in some cases we were
trying to update a column on a non-existent Service in the
DataBase.

This patch moves the replication_status updates for the
service into the init_with_rpc method.  That method was
just a noop stub in the parent manager class, so we just
implement it in cinder.volume.manager and do what we need
with the replication update info.

Change-Id: I18b2658e2f93959f74377ccb86ce8b01b6970c60
Closes-Bug: #1555370
"}]
commit_message:
Move replication_status update to init_with_rpc

We were using host_init to read replication_status from the
driver and update the service entry in the DB.  It turns out
that on a fresh install this doesn't actually work, because
while we have multiple init methods for the backend, the
Service entry isn't actually created in a fresh deploy until
AFTER init_host.  The result was that in some cases we were
trying to update a column on a non-existent Service in the
DataBase.

This patch moves the replication_status updates for the
service into the init_with_rpc method.  That method was
just a noop stub in the parent manager class, so we just
implement it in cinder.volume.manager and do what we need
with the replication update info.

Change-Id: I18b2658e2f93959f74377ccb86ce8b01b6970c60
Closes-Bug: #1555370

commit_message:
Increase min-ready for devstack-centos7

Looking at configured nodes for jobs, we currently have:
      8   bare-precise
    817   devstack-centos7
     15   devstack-trusty-2-node
    541   devstack-trusty
      6   fedora-23
    380   proposal
    609   release
      8   tripleo-f22
      1   ubuntu-trusty-2-node
   6092   ubuntu-trusty
      1   wheel-mirror-ubuntu-trusty-amd64

Let's increase min-ready for devstack-centos7 to avoid waiting in case
of idle systems.

Change-Id: I2855e641d20a555783e5ee05d741547455f856fe

subject: Refactor manila check/gate queue
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-11 15:59:46.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Refactor manila check/gate queue

Manila has too many nonvoting jobs and the names of the jobs
are long and not descriptive. This patch renames several jobs
(mostly to shorten them) and removes jobs that add no
additional coverage.

Specific changes:
* Move minimal LVM job to check queue
* Remove postgres-LVM job (now covered by minimal job)
* Remove "neutron" and "multibackend" from all jobs names
  because all jobs have those and they add no information
  (except single backend job which was renamed to
  -singlebackend)
* Rename neutron-multibackend job to mysql-generic

Change-Id: I1487cb21fd17c16be3e2e3fcf31e20ffeb1594d8
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor manila check/gate queue

Manila has too many nonvoting jobs and the names of the jobs
are long and not descriptive. This patch renames several jobs
(mostly to shorten them) and removes jobs that add no
additional coverage.

Specific changes:
* Move minimal LVM job to check queue
* Remove postgres-LVM job (now covered by minimal job)
* Remove "neutron" and "multibackend" from all jobs names
  because all jobs have those and they add no information
  (except single backend job which was renamed to
  -singlebackend)
* Rename neutron-multibackend job to mysql-generic

Change-Id: I1487cb21fd17c16be3e2e3fcf31e20ffeb1594d8
