revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-11 15:18:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_rpcapi.py', 'nova/compute/rpcapi.py'], 'message': "Fix pre_live_migration result processing from legacy computes

The objectification of the live migration data ended up with a bug in
the compatibility path for the pre_live_migration result where we
convert a legacy dict response back to an object. The legacy dict
processing looks for 'pre_live_migration_result' in the input to
trigger handling of those keys, but we weren't properly wrapping the
result like that so it was never digesting those keys.

Change-Id: I5142e1cb9d526c92529fc24ee0441b5730931160
Closes-Bug: #1556126
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pre_live_migration result processing from legacy computes

The objectification of the live migration data ended up with a bug in
the compatibility path for the pre_live_migration result where we
convert a legacy dict response back to an object. The legacy dict
processing looks for 'pre_live_migration_result' in the input to
trigger handling of those keys, but we weren't properly wrapping the
result like that so it was never digesting those keys.

Change-Id: I5142e1cb9d526c92529fc24ee0441b5730931160
Closes-Bug: #1556126

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-03-10 16:59:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_volume_types.py', 'cinder/volume/volume_types.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_types_manage.py', 'releasenotes/notes/permit_volume_type_operations-b2e130fd7088f335.yaml'], 'message': 'Permit volume type operations for policy authorized users

Currently, following volume type operations are not
permitted for non admin users because these db operations
require admin context.

* create
* update
* delete
* type-access-add
* type-access-remove

In order to allow a cloud operator to use the policy based
user access control for these operations, a context during
these operations should be elevated before db operations.

After applying this change, the cloud operator can manage
policy for volume type operations like this.

1. To permit volume type operations for specific user,
   add "storage_type_admin" role.

2. Add "admin_or_storage_type_admin" rule to policy.json.
   "admin_or_storage_type_admin":
       "is_admin:True or role:storage_type_admin",

3. Modify rule for types_manage.
   "volume_extension:types_manage":
       "rule:admin_or_storage_type_admin",

Change-Id: I1e91ad6573f78cfa35c36209944ea1d074a17604
Closes-Bug: #1538305
'}]
commit_message:
Permit volume type operations for policy authorized users

Currently, following volume type operations are not
permitted for non admin users because these db operations
require admin context.

* create
* update
* delete
* type-access-add
* type-access-remove

In order to allow a cloud operator to use the policy based
user access control for these operations, a context during
these operations should be elevated before db operations.

After applying this change, the cloud operator can manage
policy for volume type operations like this.

1. To permit volume type operations for specific user,
   add "storage_type_admin" role.

2. Add "admin_or_storage_type_admin" rule to policy.json.
   "admin_or_storage_type_admin":
       "is_admin:True or role:storage_type_admin",

3. Modify rule for types_manage.
   "volume_extension:types_manage":
       "rule:admin_or_storage_type_admin",

Change-Id: I1e91ad6573f78cfa35c36209944ea1d074a17604
Closes-Bug: #1538305

subject: Add provnet info to API results.
revisions:

The provider network API extension details were supported, but were
never returned from the API.  This patch makes these fields show up
for networks in the API.

The implementation will likely change in the near future once we're
able to store this info in the Neutron db, instead.  That depends on
this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242393/

Closes-bug: #1553368
Change-Id: I97622966bcfd5824e50fe5b7a5c222e02c53b0a7
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add provnet info to API results.

The provider network API extension details were supported, but were
never returned from the API.  This patch makes these fields show up
for networks in the API.

The implementation will likely change in the near future once we're
able to store this info in the Neutron db, instead.  That depends on
this patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242393/

Closes-bug: #1553368
Change-Id: I97622966bcfd5824e50fe5b7a5c222e02c53b0a7
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-03-11 13:33:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': 'Insure resource tracker updated for deleted instances

Instances left in a deleted state at compute manager startup were
not being explicitly cleaned up in the resoruce tracker. To address
this _update_resource_tracker is now called from solely the
_complete_deletion method. That method is called both by the
_init_instance and _delete_instance code paths, both of which should
be doing cleanup in the resource tracker when the vm is DELETED.

Note that this change does mean that if _delete_instance has an
exception, _update_resource_tracker will not be called. This is
considered okay because we cannot guarantee at which stage the
exception happened and the state of the resources involved. For safety
it is better to err on the side of "in use".

Change-Id: I586c0305ea0e20d98697bc9173ca0f89dc2b228c
Related-Bug: #1227925
'}]
commit_message:
Insure resource tracker updated for deleted instances

Instances left in a deleted state at compute manager startup were
not being explicitly cleaned up in the resoruce tracker. To address
this _update_resource_tracker is now called from solely the
_complete_deletion method. That method is called both by the
_init_instance and _delete_instance code paths, both of which should
be doing cleanup in the resource tracker when the vm is DELETED.

Note that this change does mean that if _delete_instance has an
exception, _update_resource_tracker will not be called. This is
considered okay because we cannot guarantee at which stage the
exception happened and the state of the resources involved. For safety
it is better to err on the side of "in use".

Change-Id: I586c0305ea0e20d98697bc9173ca0f89dc2b228c
Related-Bug: #1227925

commit_message:
Storwize/SVC: Clone between different size volumes

The source volume size is equal to target volume size
in most cases of create_cloned_volume. But in some
scenario, the target volume size may be bigger
than the source volume size. SVC driver should
support such scenario.

Change-Id: I1598381037a516dca611f5060d3f41195bbe3e17
Closes-Bug: 1533188

subject: NetApp: volume resize using clone fails with QoS
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6491, 'name': 'xing-yang', 'email': 'xingyang105@gmail.com', 'username': 'xing-yang'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 12540, 'name': 'Eddie Lin', 'email': 'edlin@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'ed3ed3', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14797, 'name': 'Violin Memory V6000 CI', 'email': 'vmem-openstack-ci@vmem.com', 'username': 'vmem-openstack-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16269, 'name': 'Hitachi HBSD CI', 'email': 'OpenStackCI@hds.com', 'username': 'hitachi-hbsd-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16660, 'name': 'Hitachi HBSD2 CI', 'email': 'OpenStackCI2@hds.com', 'username': 'hitachi-hbsd2-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 13:07:16.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_block_base.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/block_base.py'], 'message': "NetApp: volume resize using clone fails with QoS

Data ONTAP cannot resize a LUN past the geometry established
when the LUN was created. So to resize past that limit, the
DOT drivers create a new LUN of the needed size and clone
the original LUN into it. This process doesn't always work
if a QoS policy is in place, and the fix is to not pass the
QoS policy to the clone operation.

The fix is trivial, and I improved the surrounding code a
little, but there was no unit test coverage for the method
in question, so this commit also adds full coverage for the
LUN clone method.

Change-Id: I04dcf7ba329a9b94a39580b1115a9dec41231b85
Closes-Bug: #1550478
"}]
commit_message:
NetApp: volume resize using clone fails with QoS

Data ONTAP cannot resize a LUN past the geometry established
when the LUN was created. So to resize past that limit, the
DOT drivers create a new LUN of the needed size and clone
the original LUN into it. This process doesn't always work
if a QoS policy is in place, and the fix is to not pass the
QoS policy to the clone operation.

The fix is trivial, and I improved the surrounding code a
little, but there was no unit test coverage for the method
in question, so this commit also adds full coverage for the
LUN clone method.

Change-Id: I04dcf7ba329a9b94a39580b1115a9dec41231b85
Closes-Bug: #1550478

commit_message:
Add engine service RPC api for credentials

This is the first step to revise the 'trust' middleware. Currently it is
invoking DB APIs directly which is making the senlin-api service
involved into DB interactions. This can and should be revised to make
the middleware interact with the service engine instead of DB.

Change-Id: I98b7ce60ff923a29272299c11ffdd679f628e860

commit_message:
Update Pure replication to cheesecake

Migration to cheesecake replication. This basically
modifies any of the existing replication code to work on the whole
backend instead of the specified volume.

It also completes the transition to allow swapping the underlying array
being managed by cinder upon failover. In the v2 implementation it was
conditional on some operations where things *could* be on the other
array. Now it is all driver operations.

This also switches the target_device_id to backend_id in the config for
replication devices.

Change-Id: I7f2580f4d764266b62a755cb4529c290e639984c
Closes-Bug: #1542100

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-10 13:19:20.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/objects/volume_type.py', 'cinder/objects/base.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_actions.py', 'cinder/objects/volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/v2/stubs.py', 'cinder/objects/snapshot.py'], 'message': 'Add volume_type to volume object expected_attrs

We haven't had volume_type in expected_attrs for volume objects lists.
This resulted in situation in which although we were joining the
volume_type explicitely in DB API, the object just dropped the data.
Volume type was then lazy loaded when needed, so every "cinder list"
call was making additional DB queries per returned volume, causing
massive performance drop.

Actually there were two unnecessary DB calls per volume, because not
only volume_type was fetched, but also volume_type.extra_specs as a result
of passing 'extra_specs' in expected_attrs when calling
VolumeType._from_db_volume in Volume._from_db_volume (wow, that's
complicated…).

This commit sorts this out by adding volume_type to expected_attrs to
match what we join in the DB. Please note that I'm not adding
consistencygroup and volume_attachment on purpose - addition causes some
unit tests failure and that late in the release it seems risky to try
fixing that. The changes also required minor rework of expected_attrs
infrastructure in the o.vo layer to be able to pass different values
when we query for just a single volume and when we fetch whole list (as
we're doing different joins in the DB layer in both cases).

Change-Id: Iabf9c3fab56ffef50695ce45745f193273822b39
Closes-Bug: 1555153
'}]
commit_message:
Add volume_type to volume object expected_attrs

We haven't had volume_type in expected_attrs for volume objects lists.
This resulted in situation in which although we were joining the
volume_type explicitely in DB API, the object just dropped the data.
Volume type was then lazy loaded when needed, so every "cinder list"
call was making additional DB queries per returned volume, causing
massive performance drop.

Actually there were two unnecessary DB calls per volume, because not
only volume_type was fetched, but also volume_type.extra_specs as a result
of passing 'extra_specs' in expected_attrs when calling
VolumeType._from_db_volume in Volume._from_db_volume (wow, that's
complicated…).

This commit sorts this out by adding volume_type to expected_attrs to
match what we join in the DB. Please note that I'm not adding
consistencygroup and volume_attachment on purpose - addition causes some
unit tests failure and that late in the release it seems risky to try
fixing that. The changes also required minor rework of expected_attrs
infrastructure in the o.vo layer to be able to pass different values
when we query for just a single volume and when we fetch whole list (as
we're doing different joins in the DB layer in both cases).

Change-Id: Iabf9c3fab56ffef50695ce45745f193273822b39
Closes-Bug: 1555153

This fix makes OVS events to be received only once. By using the
set_ev_handler decorator, methods are registered only as handlers, and

Change-Id: I94ecd629f7a92b456d87d3570b981cd870062301
'}]
commit_message:
Fix receiving OVS events twice

This fix makes OVS events to be received only once. By using the
set_ev_handler decorator, methods are registered only as handlers, and
not as observers (as with the set_ev_cls decorator).

Change-Id: I94ecd629f7a92b456d87d3570b981cd870062301

fixtures 1.2.1 requires testtools<2.0.0.

kilo g-r caps fixtures<1.3.0 and testtools<2.0.0.

We have to add testtools to oslo.db's requirements.txt
to use the cap from kilo g-r before testscenarios installs

which caps testtools.

Closes-Bug: #1555721

commit_message:
Add testtools to requirements.txt

testscenarios has an uncapped dependency on testtools.

testtools 2.0.0 requires fixtures>=1.3.0.

fixtures 1.2.1 requires testtools<2.0.0.

kilo g-r caps fixtures<1.3.0 and testtools<2.0.0.

We have to add testtools to oslo.db's requirements.txt
to use the cap from kilo g-r before testscenarios installs
uncapped testtools, which will break since we cap fixtures,
which caps testtools.

Yay!

Also, add defaultbranch to .gitreview.

Change-Id: Ib95b8070cee6e6ff47d9c302c89577a75a28d83d
Closes-Bug: #1555721

commit_message:
Capture warnings into logs

Modules that issue warnings via the python
warnings module result in messages printed
to stderr.

This change results in them being captured
into Cinder logs instead.  This means that
logs from production environments contain
all of the relevant info for debugging
issues.

Change-Id: I16a31e1ef0df824dd513f43fd22d631fa647e004

subject: Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}, {'_account_id': 9681, 'name': 'Ryu CI', 'email': 'ryu-openstack-review@lists.sourceforge.net', 'username': 'neutronryu', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14208, 'name': 'Cisco CI', 'email': 'ml2.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ml2_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14212, 'name': 'Cisco Tail-f CI', 'email': 'tailf.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_tailf_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14213, 'name': 'Cisco N1kv CI', 'email': 'n1kv.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_n1kv_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 14571, 'name': 'Intel Experimental CI', 'email': 'openstack-networking-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15443, 'name': 'Cisco UCSM CI', 'email': 'ucsm.ci@cisco.com', 'username': 'cisco_ucsm_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-12 03:33:11.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition

When neutron server deleted all the resources of a
HA router, L3 agent can not aware that, so race
happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780
(cherry picked from commit 472d84d25cee0694500e583845718a4f377cc75c)
"}]
commit_message:
Catch PortNotFound after HA router race condition

When neutron server deleted all the resources of a
HA router, L3 agent can not aware that, so race
happened in some procedure like this:
1. Neutron server delete all resources of a HA router.
2. RPC fanout to L3 agent 1 in which the HA router was
   master state.
3. In l3 agent 2 'backup' router set itself to masert
   and notify neutron server a HA router state change
   notify.
4. PorNotFound rasied in updating router HA port status.

How the step 2 and 3 happens?
Consider that l3 agent 2 has much more HA routers than l3 agent 1,
or any reason that causes l3 agent 2 gets/processes the deleting
RPC later than l3 agent 1. Then l3 agent 1 remove HA router's
keepalived process will soonly be detected by backup router in
l3 agent 2 via VRRP protocol. Now the router deleting RPC is in
the queue of RouterUpdate or any step of a HA router deleting
procedure, and the router_info will still have 'the' router info.
So l3 agent 2 will do the state change procedure, AKA notify
the neutron server to update router state.

This patch is mainly to deal with the race by catching the
PorNotFound exception in neutron-server side.

Change-Id: I34d7347595bfceb8a70685672a6287e1a44ede6b
Closes-Bug: #1533454
Related-Bug: #1523780
(cherry picked from commit 472d84d25cee0694500e583845718a4f377cc75c)

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-10 18:49:18.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures.py', 'nova/network/model.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_fixtures.py'], 'message': 'Change SpawnIsSynchronous fixture return

In normal usage utils.spawn returns an eventlet.greenthread.GreenThread
object which has a few methods defined on it. Currently the wait() and
link() methods are used in Nova. However the SpawnIsSynchronous fixture
was returning the results of wait() directly which led to an interface
mismatch. Normally utils.spawn_n returns a greenlet object which does
not allow checking the return but in testing we have never blocked that
capability before. This could be enhanced later to be strict for spawn_n
if we choose, but it is handy to have raised exceptions pass through in
testing.

SpawnIsSynchronous now returns a GreenThread object lookalike which has
wait() and link() methods that work as expected. This allows for the
removal of the wait() method from network/model.py:NetworkInfo.

A few mocks which emulated the improper behavior were also updated.

Change-Id: I1ded81f93235e217822e385ddd983b24c6359a53
'}]
commit_message:
Change SpawnIsSynchronous fixture return

In normal usage utils.spawn returns an eventlet.greenthread.GreenThread
object which has a few methods defined on it. Currently the wait() and
link() methods are used in Nova. However the SpawnIsSynchronous fixture
was returning the results of wait() directly which led to an interface
mismatch. Normally utils.spawn_n returns a greenlet object which does
not allow checking the return but in testing we have never blocked that
capability before. This could be enhanced later to be strict for spawn_n
if we choose, but it is handy to have raised exceptions pass through in
testing.

SpawnIsSynchronous now returns a GreenThread object lookalike which has
wait() and link() methods that work as expected. This allows for the
removal of the wait() method from network/model.py:NetworkInfo.

A few mocks which emulated the improper behavior were also updated.

Change-Id: I1ded81f93235e217822e385ddd983b24c6359a53

commit_message:
Create new partitioning-sfdisk element.

This element is similar to vm, but allows more flexibility
on disk partitioning. It receives a DIB_PARTITIONING_SFDISK_SCHEMA
setting, allowing to partition the disk according to project needs.

Change-Id: I01dca5d5fd670d317f7761911a1549507de6e97d

commit_message:
Add XStatic version checking job

For testing the proposed version checking job
it is being added to the experimental queue.

This check will be run in the release job as a pre-check
to ensure that the tag triggering the release matches
the version encoded in the release's files. If the version
coded in the tag doesn't match the version in the xstatic
package, it must be rejected.

Co-Authored-By: Joshua Hesketh <josh@nitrotech.org>
Change-Id: I04765ccc8c3a72758391ab147e7d5d79b828fd21

commit_message:
Remove pypy's gate for zaqarclient

This gate has been non-voting for quite a bit and I'm not aware of
anyone that's working on fixing it. The Zaqar team can't dedicate
resources to fixing this gate and removing it would help saving some
cycles in our gate. Besides, zaqar client is depending on keystone
client and openstack client, both of them don't support pypy.

Change-Id: If454d14665b1ba1aca61112c7f25e679967473eb

subject: Add --version option to disk-image-create
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-29 23:57:41.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'requirements.txt'], 'message': "Add --version option to disk-image-create

Being able to discover DIB's version from the command itself is
convenient. This patch adds a --version option to the disk-image-create
command, failing gracefully if diskimage-builder is not installed.

This adds an explicit dependency on pbr to the requirements since this
is required to run diskimage_builder/version.py outside of a test
environment.

This patch consciously chooses to only provide the long-form option
and no '-v' to allow for the future possibility that a '-v' might
indicate '--verbose' in the future.

Change-Id: I9fc084774d6c7a39a944b07680b3eb8be8e34f9c
"}]
commit_message:
Add --version option to disk-image-create

Being able to discover DIB's version from the command itself is
convenient. This patch adds a --version option to the disk-image-create
command, failing gracefully if diskimage-builder is not installed.

This adds an explicit dependency on pbr to the requirements since this
is required to run diskimage_builder/version.py outside of a test
environment.

This patch consciously chooses to only provide the long-form option
and no '-v' to allow for the future possibility that a '-v' might
indicate '--verbose' in the future.

Change-Id: I9fc084774d6c7a39a944b07680b3eb8be8e34f9c

subject: debian-minimal: configurable debootstrap components
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-12 22:04:21.000000000', 'files': ['elements/debian-minimal/pre-install.d/01-debian-apt-update', 'elements/debian-minimal/README.rst'], 'message': "debian-minimal: configurable debootstrap components

The debian-minimal element creates /etc/apt/sources.list solely with
the 'main' component. I need to add 'non-free' and 'contribs'. I tried
to pass them via DIB_DEBIAN_COMPONENTS but it is not recognized.

Make debian-minimal to honor DIB_DEBIAN_COMPONENTS. Note that it is
comma separated for 'debootstrap', so replace commas with spaces to fit
the needs of sources.list.

Example usage:

 DIB_DEBIAN_COMPONENTS='main,non-free,contrib'

Will debootstrap with the three components then when debian-minimal is
realized pre install a sources.list that has:

  deb http://example.org/debian jessie main contrib non-free

Change-Id: I1dca2e8ffd31044a6b441ccb277298601e62f67c
"}]
commit_message:
debian-minimal: configurable debootstrap components

The debian-minimal element creates /etc/apt/sources.list solely with
the 'main' component. I need to add 'non-free' and 'contribs'. I tried
to pass them via DIB_DEBIAN_COMPONENTS but it is not recognized.

Make debian-minimal to honor DIB_DEBIAN_COMPONENTS. Note that it is
comma separated for 'debootstrap', so replace commas with spaces to fit
the needs of sources.list.

Example usage:

 DIB_DEBIAN_COMPONENTS='main,non-free,contrib'

Will debootstrap with the three components then when debian-minimal is
realized pre install a sources.list that has:

  deb http://example.org/debian jessie main contrib non-free

Change-Id: I1dca2e8ffd31044a6b441ccb277298601e62f67c

commit_message:
Improve handling about Timeout

This patch improves handling about Timeout, from the following two
points of view.

* Make StorletTimeout inherit eventlet.Timeout.
* Make storlet_gateway module raise StorletTimeout when it times
  out in storlet execution.

Change-Id: I385c3af967af623a1e4047e0433236acb83a38a1

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-16 13:10:34.000000000', 'files': ['elements/dpkg/bin/install-packages'], 'message': 'Add force-confdef in debian package install

In certain cases, with packages cached that need an upgrade,
when performing that action the system hangs waiting for
a prompt.
Add force-confdef option, that will let dpkg overwrite

Change-Id: Ifb177f9ac2c9ad29f8b92309c5b8cfe8e60a4e14
'}]
commit_message:
Add force-confdef in debian package install

In certain cases, with packages cached that need an upgrade,
when performing that action the system hangs waiting for
a prompt.
Add force-confdef option, that will let dpkg overwrite
configuration packages that were not modified. In combination
with already existing force-confold flag, it will allow
to avoid any conffile prompt.

Change-Id: Ifb177f9ac2c9ad29f8b92309c5b8cfe8e60a4e14

subject: Refactor growroot for debuggabilty
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-10 03:04:48.000000000', 'files': ['elements/growroot/static/usr/local/sbin/growroot'], 'message': 'Refactor growroot for debuggabilty

This is a slight refactor I found useful when debugging.  The
udevadmin info query will be visbile in the output of "set -x" which
helps, and is the logs/journal.

We can also reduce some calls by keeping the value and just grepping
with a herefile.

This also does some error checking and bails out if it does not see
what it needs to continue.

Change-Id: I39c4d262f9c5ce53f6b83d95b1363a74834cf2c8
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor growroot for debuggabilty

This is a slight refactor I found useful when debugging.  The
udevadmin info query will be visbile in the output of "set -x" which
helps, and is the logs/journal.

We can also reduce some calls by keeping the value and just grepping
with a herefile.

This also does some error checking and bails out if it does not see
what it needs to continue.

Change-Id: I39c4d262f9c5ce53f6b83d95b1363a74834cf2c8

commit_message:
Depend on ifupdown in simple-init

Newer distros, such as debian jessie and ubuntu xenial, do not provide
ifupdown by default, but simple-init depends on it. Add it to the pile.

Change-Id: I6f4876863c67c65a82464d4e0593015cdc839c5c

subject: Declaring the type of "router:external " parameter is incorrect.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-29 10:58:23.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/src/wadls/networking-api/src/wadl/networks.wadl'], 'message': 'Declaring the type of "router:external " parameter is incorrect.

When creating Network using Networking API v2.0, in Request parameters
table, the type of "router:external" parameter is declared "xsd:bool".
It should be updated to "xsd:boolean" for more exact.

Change-Id: If34eb334d1b926ec5978949985ea38c54113ce9e
Closes-Bug: #1551102
'}]
commit_message:
Declaring the type of "router:external " parameter is incorrect.

When creating Network using Networking API v2.0, in Request parameters
table, the type of "router:external" parameter is declared "xsd:bool".
It should be updated to "xsd:boolean" for more exact.

Change-Id: If34eb334d1b926ec5978949985ea38c54113ce9e
Closes-Bug: #1551102

oslo.db didn't support python 3.4 until it switched to

commit_message:
Skip gate-oslo.db-python34 for stable/kilo

oslo.db didn't support python 3.4 until it switched to
pymysql in 9b552046f55e56d45a9e7274e62ebb372c112c36 in
liberty, so we need to skip the py34 job for oslo.db
in kilo since it won't work.

Change-Id: I7c2c8d9f50511a950b0db7e11c480e3476bb809e

commit_message:
Fix baymodel with invalid parameter can updated.

Now, when we update baymodel with the invalid flavor_id or
master_flavor_id parameters, the baymodel can be updated
successfully.

We need to validate the flavor_id, master_flavor, keypair and so on
before patching baymodel.

Closes-Bug: #1555490
Change-Id: I4ae3cd7c0be1161dacb6f0a80c5ee1b53d06d03d

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-03-09 16:29:56.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Clean up networks with SR-IOV binding on reschedule

Currently, when instace is being rescheduled due to a
failed spawn, it's allocated network port bindings are
updated with the info of rescheduled host.
However, the inforamtion about any allocated SR-IOV devices
is not being updated, nor these devices are being reallocated
on the rescheduled host.

This patch adds a method to check if networks should
be deallocated on reschedule, based on it's VNIC type.
This will be used to trigger network cleanup on
reschedule if SR-IOV VNIC type is being used in the
port binding.

Change-Id: Ie327ef021c674f4d7fe95775906a46a49c1c82e7
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up networks with SR-IOV binding on reschedule

Currently, when instace is being rescheduled due to a
failed spawn, it's allocated network port bindings are
updated with the info of rescheduled host.
However, the inforamtion about any allocated SR-IOV devices
is not being updated, nor these devices are being reallocated
on the rescheduled host.

This patch adds a method to check if networks should
be deallocated on reschedule, based on it's VNIC type.
This will be used to trigger network cleanup on
reschedule if SR-IOV VNIC type is being used in the
port binding.

Change-Id: Ie327ef021c674f4d7fe95775906a46a49c1c82e7

The current API allows listings of the neturon server
version without authentication. Because pecan was treating
this like a normal controller, it was requiring keystone

This adjusts the version listing to behave as a wrapper so

commit_message:
Pecan: Allow unauthenticated version listing

The current API allows listings of the neturon server
version without authentication. Because pecan was treating
this like a normal controller, it was requiring keystone
authentication.

This adjusts the version listing to behave as a wrapper so
it can be placed outside of the keystone authentication
wrapper to allow anonymous queries.

Closes-Bug: #1556038
Change-Id: I9f5aa3bea0e11c5e179fc286f9fa350b3930364f

commit_message:
Rename flavor name used in gate tests

A better description than magnum2 would be helpful as
we are creating a smaller vm.
So renamed m1.magnum2 to s1.magnum to indicate its a slave flavor.

Change-Id: Ibd74931e0b5b2ac98dc960b31aa2b64a721200ea
Closes-Bug: #1543338

subject: Use python-troveclient versions from global-requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-03-10 01:34:16.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Use python-troveclient versions from global-requirements

Testing stable/liberty trove against trunk python-troveclient
is just asking for trouble, especially when things like
a5234f0a07230e0d8195687e033adfe4cc0ad522 break backward
compatibility in python-troveclient.

This change makes the tests use the versions bounded in
stable/liberty global-requirements.

Closes-Bug: #1538506

Change-Id: I0bfa6ef82dd1a34bca81faac7b7690c19e9365a9
'}]
commit_message:
Use python-troveclient versions from global-requirements

Testing stable/liberty trove against trunk python-troveclient
is just asking for trouble, especially when things like
a5234f0a07230e0d8195687e033adfe4cc0ad522 break backward
compatibility in python-troveclient.

This change makes the tests use the versions bounded in
stable/liberty global-requirements.

Closes-Bug: #1538506

Change-Id: I0bfa6ef82dd1a34bca81faac7b7690c19e9365a9

commit_message:
Report instance-actions for live migration force complete API

There isn't instance-action reported by new live migration force
complete API. This is async API, so there isn't a way for user
to know if there is error happened in this API. This patch add
instance-actions report to it

Change-Id: I29dc8ce0aa576ef55d2a4dfbaa6bd1f2bfd90371
Closes-Bug: #1553050

commit_message:
Refactor TestFernetTokenProvider trust-scoped tests

These tests were not specific to the Fernet provider and they should live in
the general TokenAPITests class so that the behavior is tested against all
token providers.

Subsequent patches will clean up all unused methods in TestFernetTokenProvider.

Change-Id: Ib507dec9eedf82c72bf50451df2bd0a60e48e846

This patch is removing the use of pipes from the virsh's list_all and
list_running commands. The pipes do hide real errors making Ironic
believe that the domain is shutdown while in reality it's activated.

Nonetheless, it's better to have simpler commands for sanity's sake.

Closes-Bug: #1555565
Change-Id: I62a5b292891a44e3f4b82edd90b6e4402c50fabf
"}]
commit_message:
SSH driver: Remove pipes from virsh's list_{all, running}

This patch is removing the use of pipes from the virsh's list_all and
list_running commands. The pipes do hide real errors making Ironic
believe that the domain is shutdown while in reality it's activated.

Nonetheless, it's better to have simpler commands for sanity's sake.

Closes-Bug: #1555565
Change-Id: I62a5b292891a44e3f4b82edd90b6e4402c50fabf

commit_message:
Mock swiftclient's functions in tests

swiftclient changed their code so if the chuck size is greater than
zero it will return a generator otherwise it will return the response.
Which would be the object you are looking for.  This causes our tests
to fail since they are always expecting the response instead of a
generator.

Closes-bug: 1556059

(cherry picked from commit 851508c2bff70d2857f7d0cdb9eb684f0288450b)
Co-Authored-by: avarner <avarner@us.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I62cc037493af87373a75e37e2d9f33b8aedf9889

commit_message:
Fix ipset can't be destroyed when last rule is deleted

when it deletes a security group all rules, it should
include this sg information in RPC method
'security_group_info_for_devices', otherwise the ports
in this sg can't corrcectly update their iptables and
ipset sets.

Related-bug: #1491131
Closes-bug: #1460562
(cherry picked from commit 764f018f50ac7cd42c29efeabaccbb5aec21f6f4)
(cherry picked from commit 114949b789eca7ef88ec4c43f1bb0b7233abd69c)

Conflicts neutron/tests/unit/test_security_groups_rpc.py, tests
adapted for py26 compatibility.
Change-Id: Ibb071ce84590bd46cda2c1e010a566e75e22b4d2
